snippet: Mitt Romney said that under his plan, those with existing conditions would be guaranteed access to health insurance, but that would apply only to patients who maintained continuous coverage.
abstract: Mitt Romney's pledge to guarantee access to health insurance for people with longstanding medical problems confuses some experts, and highlights the difficulty he would face in attempting to repeal the new health care law while keeping some of its most popular features.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ABBY GOODNOUGH

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney said that under his plan, those with existing conditions would be guaranteed access to health insurance, but that would apply only to patients who maintained continuous coverage.

headline.seo: Romney’s Pledge Shows Repealing Health Law to be Complex
headline.main: It Will Be Tricky for Romney to Keep Best of Health Law While Repealing It
headline.print_headline: It Will Be Tricky for Romney to Keep Best of Health Law While Repealing It

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
